summary: This is an email chain regarding Jeffrey Epstein's 2019 bail proceedings. It forwards a message from the judge's chambers to defense counsel, requesting underlying documents related to Epstein's claimed compliance with New Mexico sex offender registration requirements. The forwarded message quotes a defense claim that Epstein was not required to register in New Mexico but did so out of caution.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the bail proceedings and the discussion regarding his compliance with New Mexico sex offender registration requirements stemming from his 2008 Florida conviction.

events.title: Florida Conviction
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was convicted in Florida for Procuring Person Under 18 for Prostitution.

events.title: New Mexico Registration Inquiry
events.description: The New Mexico Public Safety Department formally advised that Epstein was not required to register in the state for his 2008 Florida conviction.

events.title: Defense Letter Filed
events.description: Defense counsel submitted a letter to the court, which included claims about Epstein's New Mexico registration status and compliance.

events.title: Court Request for Documents
events.description: The court (via chambers) requested all underlying New Mexico documents referenced in the defense's July 16 letter by noon the following day.

keyFacts: The document is part of the 2019 federal case (19cr490) against Jeffrey Epstein.
A key bail issue concerned whether Epstein properly notified New Mexico authorities of his presence in the state, given his 2008 Florida sex crime conviction.
The defense claimed the New Mexico Public Safety Department stated in August 2010 that Epstein was not required to register there for his Florida conviction.
The defense further claimed Epstein notified a New Mexico detective out of an 'abundance of caution' when at his residence there.
The court requested all underlying documents supporting these claims by noon on July 18, 2019.
